reg.title: Vancouver Olympic and Paralympic Facilities Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 196/2009, August 27, 2009]

definition.def: means a structure consisting of a pliable membrane which achieves and maintains its shape and support by internal air pressure;

means the occupancy or the use of a building, or part thereof, by a gathering of persons for civic, political, travel, religious, social, educational, recreational or like purposes, or for the consumption of food or drink;
means the British Columbia Building Code established under section 2 of the British Columbia Building Code Regulation, B.C. Reg. 216/2006;
means any structure used or intended for supporting or sheltering any use or occupancy;
means a metal transportable structure that is used for occupancy and is

paragraph.paragraphtext: 2.5 m in width,
2.6 m in height, and
6.1 m or 12.2 m in length;

definition.def: means the use or intended use of a building or part thereof for the shelter or support of persons, animals or property;
means a building that the Vancouver Organizing Committee leases, operates or administers for the purposes of the 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games and that is located

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the City of Richmond,
in the District of West Vancouver,
in the Resort Municipality of Whistler,
in the Squamish Lillooet Regional District,
in the City of North Vancouver,
in the District of North Vancouver,
in the City of Surrey,
in the City of Coquitlam,
in the City of Burnaby,
in the City of Abbotsford,
in the City of Pitt Meadows,
in the Corporation of Delta, or
on property of the University of British Columbia;

definition.def: means a portable modular building that consists of

paragraph.paragraphtext: one portable module, or
more than one portable module if the portable modules are attached to each other;

definition.def: means the Vancouver Organizing Committee for the 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, a society incorporated in British Columbia with the registration number XS - 0047023.

section.marginalnote: Application of Part 3 of the Code
section.sectiontext: An Olympic facility that is a temporary building and meets the description of article 1.3.3.3, Division A, of the British Columbia Building Code is exempt from Part 9, Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code, and Part 3, Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code applies instead, subject to the exemptions set out in this regulation.
An Olympic facility is exempt from sentence 3.1.5.12. (7), Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the panel has metal facing on both sides that is attached to a foamed plastic insulation core,
the exposed edges of the panel are covered with metal caps,
the foamed plastic has a flame-spread rating of less than 25 when tested to CAN/ULC-S102-03, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies", and
the panel does not contain an air space.

section.sectiontext: An Olympic facility that has temporary ceilings or temporary partitions installed for the purposes of the 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games is exempt from the requirement in article 3.2.5.13, Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code in respect of the temporary ceilings or temporary partitions if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the installation of temporary ceilings is limited to concentrated areas of not more than 50% of the sprinkler design area of the building as determined by NFPA 13-1999, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems", for the relevant hazard classification with concentrated areas of temporary ceilings separated from adjacent temporary ceilings by a minimum open area of 3 m width, or
the temporary partition is not located more than 300 mm from a fire sprinkler head.

section.sectiontext: An Olympic facility with temporary indoor seating or permanent indoor seating affected by temporary indoor seating is exempt from the following in Division B of the British Columbia Building Code in respect of the indoor seating:

paragraph.paragraphtext: sentence 3.3.2.5. (6) if the length of travel to an exit door by any aisle does not exceed 70 m;
sentence 3.3.2.2. (3) and the requirements in sentence 3.2.5.13. (1) in respect of fire separation and sprinkler requirements under seating;
sentences 3.4.6.4. (5) and (7);
the requirements in sentence 3.4.6.5. (5) in respect of the triangular space created by the stair tread, stair rise and the underside of the tread;
clause 3.4.6.7. (1) (a) if the minimum stair run is not less than 250 mm and the front of the tread has a contrasting colour;
sentence 3.4.6.7. (5);
the requirement in clause 3.8.3.15. (1) (b) to provide a clear view of the event taking place if the guard height is not less than 840 mm in front of the wheelchair viewing position.

section.sectiontext: An Olympic facility is exempt from sentence 3.4.5.1. (3), Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code if the exit signs meet the self-illumination standards set out in ULC/ORD C924-02, "Photoluminescent and Self Luminous Exit Signs".
An Olympic facility that is a metal shipping container is exempt from the British Columbia Building Code if the container is not accessible by the general public.
An Olympic facility that is temporary outdoor seating is exempt from the following in Division B of the British Columbia Building Code:

paragraph.paragraphtext: sentence 3.2.5.13. (1) in respect of fire separation and sprinkler requirements under seating;
the requirements in sentence 3.3.2.2. (3) in respect of fire separation and sprinkler requirements under seating;
sentence 3.4.6.4. (7);
the requirements in sentence 3.4.6.5. (5) in respect of the triangular space created by the stair tread, stair rise and the underside of the tread;
the requirements in sentence 3.4.6.5. (7) in respect of connectors to attach horizontal rails;
clause 3.4.6.7. (1) (a) if the minimum stair run is not less than 250 mm and the front of the tread has a contrasting colour;
sentence 3.4.6.7. (5);
the requirement in clause 3.8.3.15. (1) (b) to provide a clear view of the event taking place if the guard height is not less than 840 mm in front of the wheelchair viewing position.

subsection.subsectiontext: An Olympic facility that is a permanent building is exempt from subsection 3.7.2, Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code, and portable toilet facilities may be used as required plumbing facilities for supplemental occupant load of the permanent building.

An Olympic facility that is a temporary building is exempt from subsection 3.7.2., Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code, if portable toilet facilities are used as required plumbing facilities for occupant load for the temporary building.

section.sectiontext: An Olympic facility that is a storage garage is exempt from article 3.3.5.6, Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code.

paragraph.paragraphtext: media broadcasts,
cameras,
ceremonies and presentations,
audio, video and lighting purposes, or
similar purposes

section.marginalnote: Exemption — elements of structures, non-structural components and equipment
section.sectiontext: An Olympic facility that has temporary elements of structures, non-structural components and equipment that are required to be seismically restrained is exempt from article 4.1.8.17., Division B, of the British Columbia Building Code.
This regulation is repealed effective May 30, 2010.
